Sequence Information.Source: sequence reversal, sequence shuffling, designed, man-made sequences

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (50%) toNigrocin-HLMK: 33%; L: 20%, V: 13%.Activity: active against Gram+ E.faecalis PCM 2673 (MIC 128 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 25923 or 9144 (MIC 64 ug/ml), S.pneumoniae ATCC 49619 (MIC 128 ug/ml), Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or 23506 (MIC 64-128 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC 32 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 256 ug/ml), fungi  A.niger ATCC 16404 (MIC 256 ug/ml), C.albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 128 ug/ml), and C.glabrata ATCC 15126 (MIC 256 ug/ml).SAR: sequence reversal reduced peptide activity by 4-fold, indicating the importance of the native AMP.In vitro toxicity: 4% human RBC: no hemolysis at the MIC.Structure:  helical in SDS or DPC.
Literature Information.Author: Neubauer D, Jaskiewicz M, Migon D, Bauer M, Sikora K, Sikorska E, Kamysz E, Kamysz W. 2017
Literature Information.Title: Retro analog concept: comparative study on physico-chemical and biological properties of selected antimicrobial peptides.
